content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #83341 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
(personally I don't think this needs to be prioritized, rustbot just added the label automatically)
ok for me. is there anything we can do to follow up on this issue? The reporter did some nice work to investigate the regression. Could any of the WG be interested in checking this?
I don't know if there's a procedure or someone to alert for these kind of issues.
I'm not sure but we could ping Nicholas, the author of #66408, they're very familiar with the compiler performance issues

Unfortunately @njn has had to take a break from contributing to Rust. I’m hoping they will resume contributing in the future, but its not reasonable to expect them to weigh in on this in the short term, I suspect.

The original PR reported perf improvements but worse "wall-time"
(which I'm not entirely sure what that means)

as for the question of whether this needs a priority label… I guess I had hoped that we would strive to prioritize all issues eventually. But I’m probably going to have to accept that this is not a realistic aim, and that we should adopt a more nuanced one
e.g. maybe priority labels can be optional for issues tags as I-slow? Not sure.
if we did give this a priority, it would probably be P-medium
(just thinking aloud) maybe a threshold above which a perf regression should be looked into. There are many I-slow but as you said they require quite a bit of context
